member.name: F:Conversations.Kernel.ConversationHelpers.MultiToolToolName
member.summary: Function names used to call functions in argument in parallel.
member.remarks: This appears to be an internal function to make function calls happen in parallel, but sometimes it gets passed to us directly.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.ConversationHelpers.PushMultiTool(CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest,Microsoft.Extensions.AI.FunctionCallContent,Conversations.Abstractions.IStreamingResponse)
member.summary: Handle the multi_tool_use.parallel format.
member.remarks: Sometimes the model comes back with an alternate format where the single tool call is a call to parallelize calls, the arguments contain the individual calls.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotChatHistory.GetExchanges(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotInteraction})
member.summary: Takes a list of interactions in a conversation and groups them into an ordered list of exchanges, where each exchange contains a request with its associated responses.
member.returns: The conversation interactions groups into turns.
member.remarks: In the special case where a conversation starts with responses instead of a request, all responses preceding the first request will be grouped into the initial exchange, followed by an exchange with the first request and subsequent response(s).

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotChatHistory.GetResponseMessagesWithToolCallsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotResponse,Conversations.Abstractions.IContextProviders,CopilotExchangeContextEvaluation,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets all of the response messages for this request including any tool call requests and results. Tool results that are represented as can be included in a reduced form if a that contains the tool context is also provided.
member.param: The context providers to use for evaluation.

A context evaluation to use for rendering tool result messages. If provided, tool results can be included in a reduced form. Otherwise, the full tool result value will be used without attempting reduction.

member.name: T:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotModelResolver
member.summary: This class is responsible for discovering which models are available in the Copilot service and selecting the best model for a given request based on the intersection of the set of models supported by the service and the set of models supported by the clients.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotModelResolver.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Conversations.CopilotClient.ICopilotAPIClient,Conversations.Shared.Options.IMarshaledCopilotOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The LLM client to discover available models on the service.
The options that contain the list of client-supported models.
The interval at which to allow a background refresh of models. Defaults to one hour if not specified.

The interval at which to allow a force refresh of models in the background. This interval is usually shorter than the background refresh interval so that updates to the model list are detected sooner during outages. Defaults to five minutes if not specified.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotModelResolver.GetModelsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotClientId,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the list of models that are available for requests based on the intersection of the set of models supported by the service and the set of models supported by the clients.
member.param: The client id of the client getting the models.
member.returns: The list of models that can be used for a request.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotModelResolver.SelectModelAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotModelRequest,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotClientId,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Selects the best model for a given request based on the intersection of the set of models supported by the service and the set of models supported by the clients.
member.param: The request for which to select a model.
The client id of the client selecting the model.
member.returns: The best model for the given request.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.CopilotModelResolver.SelectModelAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotModelRequest},Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotClientId,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Selects the best model for a given list of model requests based on the intersection of the set of models supported by the service and the set of models supported by the clients. Each model request will be evaluated in order, returning the first matching model.
member.param: The list of requests for which to select a model.
The client id of the client selecting the model.
member.returns: The best model for the given request.

member.summary: Factory for creating memory for the kernel

member.name: F:Conversations.Kernel.RemoteAgentConversation.ToolResultTypeName
member.summary: A placeholder type name for tool results to be reported as copilot references. In future we may utilize more specific names but there is no spec available at the moment.

member.name: F:Conversations.Kernel.RemoteAgentConversation.FallbackAgentModel
member.summary: The client might not know what model a remote agent is using, but at the same time, we need to know the model in order to do context reduction and token counting on the client side before submitting the request. So we setup a fake model that the client can use to do context reduction and token counting if we are unsure which model the remote agent will use.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.RequestBuilder.BaseRequestBuilder.BuildAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Builds the set of request messages for a given request using the inputs provided in the constructor.
member.returns: A list of chat messages that can be sent to the Copilot model.
member.remarks: This method builds up all of the required components of the request and then delegates the addition of the optional components to derived classes. Each derived class can decide how to allocate the remaining tokens towards any optional components in the inputs. This method is virtual to enable a derived class to fully customize the request building process, including changing the required components or the final message ordering of the composed request. Most derived classes will only need to implement the method.

member.name: M:Conversations.Kernel.RequestBuilder.BaseRequestBuilder.AddHistoryAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Adds history messages to the request, one turn at a time in reverse-chronological order.
member.param: The budget to use for history. If not specified, all of the remaining tokens will be available as the budget.
member.returns: A task representing the completion of adding any history to the request.
member.remarks: This is not called by the base class, but it exists in the base class because it is shared among several derived classes and avoids the derived classes needing to duplicate the logic.

member.name: P:Conversations.Kernel.Speculation.CopilotAPISpeculationRequest.Temperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:Conversations.Kernel.Speculation.CopilotAPISpeculationRequest.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to stream the response. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Conversations.Kernel.Speculation.CopilotAPISpeculationRequest.Stop

member.name: M:Conversations.Utils.Implementation.CopilotChatResponseMessageReader`2.TryHandleChunk(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Gives the inheriting class a chance to observe and process a chunk before any operations.
member.param: Output response object to be returned if method returns true.
member.returns: Returns true if chunk was handled and a response was generated that should be returned. Returns false if processing should continue as normal.

member.name: M:Conversations.Utils.Implementation.CopilotChatResponseMessageReader`2.ProcessChunk(`0)
member.summary: Gives the inheriting class a chance to observe a chunk and do post processing. This method does not impact rest of the stream reading.

member.remarks: Larger size used by default to minimize number of reads. Smaller size used in debug to stress growth/shifting logic.

member.summary: The stream to be parsed.

member.summary: The parser delegate used to transform bytes into a .

member.summary: Indicates whether the enumerable has already been used for enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._lineBuffer
member.summary: Buffer, either empty or rented, containing the data being read from the stream while looking for the next line.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._lineOffset
member.summary: The starting offset of valid data in .

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._lineLength
member.summary: The length of valid data in , starting from .

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._newlineIndex
member.summary: The index in where a newline ('\r', '\n', or "\r\n") was found.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._lastSearchedForNewline
member.summary: The index in of characters already checked for newlines.
member.remarks: This is to avoid O(LineLength^2) behavior in the rare case where we have long lines that are built-up over multiple reads. We want to avoid re-checking the same characters we've already checked over and over again.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._eof
member.summary: Set when eof has been reached in the stream.

member.summary: Rented buffer containing buffered data for the next event.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._dataLength
member.summary: The length of valid data in , starting from index 0.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._dataAppended
member.summary: Whether data has been appended to .
member.remarks: This can be different than != 0 if empty data was appended.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1._eventType
member.summary: The event type for the next event.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1.LastEventId
member.summary: Gets the last event ID.
member.remarks: This value is updated any time a new last event ID is parsed. It is not reset between SSE items.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1.ReconnectionInterval
member.summary: Gets the reconnection interval.
member.remarks: If no retry event was received, this defaults to , and it will only ever be in that situation. If a client wishes to retry, the server-sent events specification states that the interval may then be decided by the client implementation and should be a few seconds.

member.name: M:System.Net.ServerSentEvents.SseParser`1.ThrowIfNotFirstEnumeration
member.summary: Transitions the object to a used state, throwing if it's already been used.

member.name: T:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to generate chat completions.

member.name: M:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.Extensions.AI.ChatMessage},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified prompt.
member.remarks: This can be used for requests to remote agents.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages to generate chat completions for, in the chat format.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the model to use.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.CopilotModel
member.summary: Gets the to use for the request.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Temperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.TopP
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of p to use for nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.N
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to stream the response. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Stop
member.summary: Gets or sets up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.MaxTokens
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. If unspecified, the response can be up to the model's maximum output size.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Gets or sets a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Gets or sets a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.LogitBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the modification of the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Tools
member.summary:
Gets or sets the functions to be considered.
When providing one or more functions the model may choose to call one of them in the response. See .
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-tools

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.ToolChoice
member.summary:
Gets the value indicating whether to consider calling in responses. Can be set to required to enforce the use of a tool in the response. If null, the implied value is "none" if no tools are provided, and "auto" if tools are provided.
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-tool_choice

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.ParallelToolCalls
member.summary:
Gets the value indicating whether to enable parallel tool calling.
Defaults to true
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-parallel_tool_calls

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.OffTopicFilterText
member.summary: Gets the text to be used for off topic filtering (or not) the request.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Snippy
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration for Snippy the GitHub Copilot filter that detects code suggestions matching public code on GitHub. Snippy can be explicitly enabled or disabled by setting an 'enabled' key in the dictionary with a value of true or false. If the Snippy property is null then Snippy will be enabled/disabled depending on the configuration for the current user. For Microsoft accounts Snippy is enabled by default and cannot be disabled via GitHub https://aka.ms/copilot-chat-filtered-docs.

member.name: T:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIModelsResponse
member.summary: A response from the models API that contains a list of supported models in CAPI.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.CodeVulnerability.StartOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bytes from the beginning of the response text the annotation starts. The start offset may be negative, if the match is partly in the prompt. Not currently available.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.CodeVulnerability.EndOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bytes from the beginning of the response text the annotation stops. Not currently available.

member.name: T:CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.IPCodeCitation
member.summary: Represents an IP code citation.

member.name: T:CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.IPCodeCitationDetails
member.summary: Represents the details of an IP code citation.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.TextCopyright.StartOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets how many bytes from the beginning of the response text the annotation starts. The start offset may be negative, if the match is partly in the prompt. Not currently available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.DisposableBag.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of all elements in the collection and clears the collection.
member.remarks: Any elements added to the collection later are instead immediately disposed.

member.summary: Adds a value to be disposed of when this collection is disposed of.
member.param: The value to be disposed of when this collection is disposed of. Will be disposed of immediately if this collection is already disposed of. May be .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.DisposableBag.AddDisposables(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IDisposable})
member.summary: Adds values to be disposed of when this collection is disposed of or canceled.
member.param: The value to be disposed of when this collection is disposed of. All elements will be disposed of immediately if this collection is already disposed of. Individual elements of the collection or the collection itself may be .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.DisposableBag.RemoveDisposable(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Removes a disposable value from the collection.
member.param: The value to remove. May be .
member.remarks: No exception is thrown if the is not found in the collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Conversations.CopilotClient.AnnotationsBuilder
member.summary: De-duplicates annotations returned in the Copilot response. Streamed responses may contain the same annotation multiple times. The last update to the annotation is the one that should be used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Conversations.CopilotClient.AnnotationsBuilder.Append(CopilotClient.CopilotChatResponseStreamChunk.Annotations)
member.summary: Appends an annotation. If the annotation already exists, it will be replaced.
member.returns: True if the annotation was added or no annotations were found. False if any annotation could not be added due to missing information.

member.name: T:ChoiceConverter
member.summary: This ChoiceConverter is only here to support the Choice type returned by the Speculative decoding endpoint. It will potentially change once that endpoint stabilizes. This converter ensures we don't affect supported types, but also we can morph and accept the Speculative decoding Choice type. Which contains a `text` string instead of a `Delta` property.
